intro: Naiadia zygoseta, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a striking contrast between the petals and the green calyx. It typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Naiadia zygoseta is a perennial herb that prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
